intro: Hieracium praecurrens subsp. mikulinkae, commonly known as the Mikulinka's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, with yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. This subspecies is notable for its distinct morphology and ecological adaptations to its native habitat.
